column2: We are seeking an experienced Amazon Supply Chain Strategist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to optimize our eCommerce supply chain operations. This role requires a deep understanding of eCommerce, supply chain management, logistics, and inventory management. The eCommerce Supply Chain Strategist will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the smooth and efficient flow of products, from order placement to final delivery.                 Responsibilities:         -Develop and implement eCommerce supply chain strategies that maximize efficiency, minimize costs, and ensure customer satisfaction.   -Analyze and evaluate current supply chain processes, identify areas for improvement, and propose solutions.   -Work with cross-functional teams to ensure the integration of eCommerce supply chain operations with other business functions, including product management, marketing, and customer service.   -Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers and logistics providers, negotiate contracts, and ensure timely delivery of goods.   -Optimize inventory management and forecasting processes to reduce stockouts and minimize overstocking.   -Analyze data and prepare reports on supply chain performance, including metrics such as on-time delivery, fill rates, and inventory turns.   -Keep abreast of industry trends and best practices in eCommerce supply chain management, and apply them to our operations as appropriate.               Qualifications:         -Bachelors degree in business, supply chain management, logistics, or a related field.   -3+ years of experience in Amazon supply chain management or a related field.   -Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data and identify trends and opportunities.   -Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.   -Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.   -Knowledge of eCommerce platforms, order management systems, and other related tools and technologies.   -Understanding of logistics and transportation modes, including parcel, LTL, FTL, and intermodal.
column11: Supply chain, Order management, Product management, Supply chain management, Analytical, Supply chain operations, E-commerce, Customer service, Forecasting, Logistics

column2: Skill required:  Supply Chain - Automotive Supply Chain Designation:  Business Advisory Senior Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  What would you do? Help our Automotive client to expedite their part delivery from Suppliers to warehouseYou will be a part of Part Expediting team where in you will be accountable for expediting by following up with supplier by calls or Teams meeting. Your aim will be to make sure the part reaches the warehouse within target date. This role requires making multiple calls to suppliers during day as part of follow up activity. You may also be assigned with group of individuals managing suppliers. Analyze, improve and optimize automotive supply chains to make them more effective, efficient and resilient through digitization. What are we looking for? Supplier Relationship Management Ability to perform under pressure Problem-solving skills Ability to establish strong client relationship Results orientation Prioritization of workload Problem Solving Reverse Logistics Supply Chain Execution  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of increasingly complex problems Your day to day interactions are with peers within Accenture You are likely to have some interaction with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given minimal instruction on daily work/tasks and a moderate level of instruction on new assignments Decisions that are made by you impact your own work and may impact the work of others In this role you would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Any Graduation

column2: We are looking for a Demand Generation Executive to develop and implement strategies to generate leads and revenue for the company. You will be responsible for working closely with the sales and marketing teams to align efforts, and using data and analytics to measure and improve performance. The ideal candidate will have experience in demand generation, a deep understanding of the sales process, and strong analytical and communication skills. Responsibilities Develop and implement demand generation strategies and campaigns Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to align efforts and drive revenue Use data and analytics to measure and improve the performance of demand generation efforts Develop and maintain relationships with partners, influencers, and other stakeholders Collaborate with other departments, such as product and customer service, to create cohesive demand generation efforts Monitor industry trends and stay up-to-date on new technologies and techniques Conduct market and customer research to identify opportunities and challenges Create and manage demand generation budgets and forecasts Measure and report on the success of demand generation campaigns, using metrics such as leads, conversions, and revenue Identify and resolve challenges and conflicts within the demand generation process Provide training and support to team members on demand generation best practices and tools Attend industry events and conferences to build relationships and promote the company Requirements and skills 3-4 years of experience in demand generation or a related field Proficiency in marketing automation and CRM software Strong analytical skills, with experience analyzing data and making data-driven decisions Knowledge of sales techniques and strategies Excellent communication and collaboration skills Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills A desire to learn and grow in the demand generation field Bachelors degree in marketing or related field Knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools, such as Tableau, is a plus.

column2: A) Job description:-   1. DEVELOP DEMAND FORECASTS (OPERATIONAL FORECASTS) AT MULTIPLE LEVELS OF AGGREGATION FOR MULTIPLE TIME HORIZONS AS PART OF A DEMAND PLANNING FUNCTION.   2. REVIEW HISTORICAL SALES TRENDS, PREPARE FORECAST DATA, DEVELOP STATISTICAL FORECAST, AND EVALUATE FORECAST RESULTS.   3. COORDINATE CROSS-FUNCTIONAL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES TO RECONCILE SIGNIFICANT VARIANCES AND REFINE THE FORECAST TO REFLECT UPDATED SALES AND MARKETING ASSUMPTIONS.   4. INTERACT WITH SALES & MARKETING, AND BUSINESS FINANCE TO UNDERSTAND DEMAND FORECAST DRIVERS.   5. UTILIZE A COLLABORATIVE AND CONSENSUS APPROACH BY WORKING WITH SALES, MARKETING AND BUSINESS FINANCE TO OBTAIN AND ENSURE THAT CURRENT AND ACCURATE INFORMATION IS USED FOR DEMAND FORECASTS.   6. USE AND MAINTAIN THE DEMAND PLANNING SOFTWARE AS THE PRIMARY FORECASTING SYSTEM TOOL.   7. PROVIDE INPUT TO THE SUPPLY PLANNING ORGANIZATION IN DEVELOPING INVENTORY STRATEGIES ON EXISTING ITEMS, NEW PRODUCTS, AND PRODUCT PHASE-OUTS.   8. CLOSELY COORDINATE AND COMMUNICATE CUSTOMER ACTION PLANS WITH SUPPLY PLANNING.   9. TO CARRY OUT AN EXHAUSTIVE MRP RUN AT CFA IN ORDER TO GENERATE ACCURATE CFA LEVEL REQUIREMNT.   10. ESSENTIAL SKILLS- ANALYTICAL ABILITY, SAP PROFICIENCY, EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION SKILLS            B) Relevant work experience - 5+ Years.     C) Education Qualification - GRADUATE+ MBA IN OPERATION.

column2: Job title: Demand Planning - Senior Executive Job Purpose and Impact The Senior Executive - Demand Planning, will help create all levels of demand plans for a group of products with low planning complexity, including data inputs, statistical forecasting, incorporation of commercial intelligence and new or discontinued products.  In this role, you will handle medium sized sets of data and collaborate with others to create a robust demand plan, enabling effective financial planning and execution throughout the supply chain.Key Accountabilities. Create and maintain all stages of the demand plan. Maintain and handle product history, accurate forecasts and promotional demand, Monitor and report on important changes in sales forecasts, budgets and business strategies. Maintain data relative to demand forecasts to include hierarchy, historical data cleansing, demand sensing data and forecast model parameters, Model based on industry trends and demand patterns, Participate in integrated business planning, working to meet demand planning key performance indicators, Support management with risks assessments and mitigation activities, Propose and implement solutions to improve demand forecast accuracy. Handle basic issues and problems under direct supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff in a timely and effective mannerSuccessfully communicate forecast and inventory estimates to managementAddress demand related issues in a timely and effective manner. Qualifications:Minimum QualificationsHigh school diploma, secondary education level or equivalentPreferred QualificationsGraduate with Postgraduate/ Diploma in Supply chain Management Should have at least 2 years of experience in demand forecasting /forecasting role. Preferably should have experience working with FMCG, Agri and Pharma Industries.Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge.Capability to multitask in a fast faced environment.Excellent written and verbal communication, Excel & Presentations Skills. Must-Haves : Total Experience - Max 5 years in Demand Planning  Relevant - 2 Years Mandatory in Demand Planning  Diversity Candidate Only Education Background should be in Supply Chain (Either Degree or a course) Work Mode - In office (5 Days), and 6th day WFH (Based on work load) Shift Timing - 9 AM - 6 PM Salary: Based on market standards

column2: As a Planning & Inventory Analyst at Mensa Brands, you will play a critical role in optimizing our supply chain operations by managing inventory levels, forecasting demand, and implementing efficient planning strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure product availability, minimize stockouts, and maximize inventory turnover.            **Responsibilities:**      1. Develop and maintain inventory planning models to optimize inventory levels and ensure product availability while minimizing excess and obsolete inventory.      2. Analyze demand patterns, sales trends, and historical data to forecast future demand for products and raw materials, and develop accurate inventory replenishment plans.      3. Monitor inventory levels across multiple warehouses and distribution centers, and proactively identify and address potential stockouts or overstock situations.      4. Collaborate with procurement and production teams to ensure timely procurement and production of materials and finished goods to meet forecasted demand and inventory targets.      5. Conduct regular inventory audits and reconcile discrepancies between physical inventory counts and system records, implementing corrective actions as necessary.      6. Analyze and report on key inventory metrics such as fill rates, stock turnover, and aging inventory, and identify opportunities for improvement and cost reduction.      7. Partner with cross-functional teams including sales, finance, and operations to develop and implement inventory management policies, procedures, and best practices.      8. Stay informed about industry trends, market dynamics, and supply chain best practices to continuously improve inventory management processes and strategies.      9. Support ad-hoc projects and initiatives related to supply chain optimization, process improvement, and system enhancements as required.            **Requirements:**      1. Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Operations Management, or a related field. Advanced degree or professional certification (e.g., APICS) is a plus.      2. 2-4 years of experience in supply chain, inventory planning, or demand forecasting roles, preferably within the e-commerce or retail industry.      3. Proficiency in inventory planning and management tools/software (e.g., ERP systems, demand planning software, Excel).      4. Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with the ability to analyze large datasets, draw insights, and make data-driven recommendations.      5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate complex concepts to stakeholders at all levels.      6. Detail-oriented mindset with strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.      7. Proactive problem-solving skills and a continuous improvement mindset, with a commitment to driving operational excellence and efficiency.
column11: Supply chain, Procurement, ERP, Supply chain management, Demand planning, Operational excellence, Analytical, Demand forecasting, Process improvement, Cost reduction

column2: The APAC Demand Planner position is part of the Global Supply Chain & Logistics team and will be located in Bangalore in Hybrid model. At Cytiva, our vision is, to advance future therapeutics from discovery to delivery.                In this role, you will have the opportunity to:              Own & lead the Regional Demand Planning processes for assigned Business Units. Lead monthly demand reviews with commercial teams. Give clear direction on forecasting goals as well as supporting demand analysis, reporting forecast changes and drivers.          Monitor/analyze sales history, report forecast changes. Develop the process of creating forecasts and replenishment plans for the region. Ensure approved 18 months demand forecast is updated timely every month in Demantra, our demand planning system.          Represent the Regional Demand Planning team in reviews with stakeholders, bringing insight and analysis to support improvement activities in areas such as sales, product management, inventory, and manufacturing.          Track forecast accuracy and work on root cause analysis for forecast improvement. Analyze regional supply performance and work with stakeholders to help and manage any supply disruptions.          Support Product Leaders on Life Cycle Management: Analyze product portfolios with respect to sales volume, value, and margins. Support and monitor new product introduction and discontinuation process, adjusting forecast accordingly.                  The essential requirements of the job include:                      Bachelor s degree in business, supply chain management, statistics or similar field required.          Minimum 5 years experience Supply Chain / Demand Planning or related field. Demonstrated knowledge of supply chain planning processes. Knowledge of MRP processes & Advanced Planning systems Demantra, APO or other ERP systems.          Proficient in statistical forecast with good understanding of time series forecast and regression models. Very strong analytical skills, able to deal with large amount of data, in multiple formats and from different sources, consolidating all data and showing ability to identify and prioritize focus areas.          Affinity to systems and use of computers/software. Good Excel and PowerPoint skills are essential.          Available for some international travel based on specific ad-hoc business needs.

column2: Roles and Responsibilities     Roles and Responsibilities   Job Description Officer / Executive - Demand & Supply Planner (Coatings) Key Accountabilities & OutcomesResponsibilities:  a. Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecast models, and evaluate forecast results b. Create base forecast based on historical sales data (primary and secondary) and market input c. Provide input to the organization in developing inventory strategies on existing items, new products, and product phase-outs. d. Work closely with manufacturing for the production scheduling and dispatch schedule adherence to ensure customer service/OTIF 95% e. Generate short term (3 Months) demand plans basis quantitative analysis and qualitative inputs from sales & marketing teams.  f. To provide 3 months demand outlook to Purchase, Production, for RM/PM procurement, Production Capacity alignment.  g. Highlight stock outs and low stock products and coordinate with supply planner for faster replenishment. h. Conduct periodic inventory check to identify excess inventory, potential obsolescence and work with finance, sales, and supply team to liquidate the same.  i. Taking the update from production daily and updating on Open Order Backlog status j. Follow up with CS & Production for any Order related information. k. Maintain RM Availability based on demand, trend, order intake. Replenish the material within time frame to avoid stock out.   Requirements:  a. Minimum Four years+ experience in Planning and Inventory Management, preferable from Paint/Coating /Chemical Manufacturing Industry b. Ability to work collaboratively across functions, including with Commercial knowledge, challenge thinking, and influence outcomes.  c. Strong experience with software tools such as Excel, ERP, and/or Access required. Proficiency in statistics, forecasting, and planning skills required, along with a good, basic business acumen. d. Demonstrated proficiency in statistics, forecasting and forecasting methods with an understanding of their financial and operational impacts. e. Accuracy, attention to detail, flexibility, and the ability to work in a fast-paced deadline driven environment. f. Should be a quick learner with ability to learn new things quickly and should be ready to accept changes as and when required. Interactions with/ Internal Relations : Manager Production/ Plant Head Department Heads Product Manager  Logistics Stores Sales& Marketing  R&D External Relations :  Client issues Sales  Key DimensionsPeople Dimensions:   Direct reports Nil Education Qualifications / Background (Any) Any Graduation OR Bachelor of Science (B Sc.) from any tier I institution.  Diploma in Supply Chain Management Experience Minimum of 4 years  in Planning and Inventory Management, preferable from Paint/Coating /Chemical Manufacturing Industry Age Limit 25 35 years. Technical/Functional Expertise Strong in MS Excel, Word, Power point and presentation skills Excellent written and oral communication skills Behavioural Competencies  Strong acumen for planning and executing production of paint/coatings Drive, dynamism and target orientation  Personality  Ability to work in cross functional settings.  Ability to multitask and work under pressure with minimum supervision in the fast paced manufacturing environment Location The candidate should be ready to stay around Nerul, Navi Mumbai area. column2: 3 to 6 years in plastic and manufacturing industries is a MUST.                                             Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.                                Key Responsibilities:                         1. Supplier Identification and Evaluation: Conduct research to identify potential suppliers and manufacturers that align with our product requirements and quality standards.                  2. Evaluate suppliers based on their reliability, pricing, product quality, production capacity, and ability to meet delivery deadlines.                  3. Build and maintain a database of approved suppliers and update it regularly.                  4. Product Sourcing and Negotiation: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to determine product specifications and sourcing needs.                  5. Source new products, components, and materials from domestic and international markets to optimize costs and diversify the supply chain.                  6. Negotiate pricing, terms, and contracts with suppliers to secure favourable agreements while ensuring long-term, mutually beneficial relationships.                  7. Quality Control and Compliance: Establish and implement quality control measures to ensure all procured products meet our companys standards and comply with relevant regulations.                  8. Conduct regular supplier audits and performance evaluations to monitor quality and identify areas for improvement.                  9. Supply Chain Optimization: Work closely with logistics and inventory teams to coordinate timely delivery of products and optimize supply chain processes.                  10. Monitor market trends and industry developments to identify potential risks and opportunities for improvement in the sourcing process.                  11. Cost Analysis and Reporting: Analyse costs, pricing structures, and market trends to identify opportunities for cost reduction and increased efficiency. 12. Prepare regular reports on product sourcing metrics, supplier performance, and cost analysis for management review.                         Qualifications and Skills:                          1. Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.                  2. Proven experience as a Product Sourcing Specialist or in a similar procurement role.                  3. Strong knowledge of supply chain management principles and best practices.                  4. Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.                  5. Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.                  6. Analytical mindset with a focus on data-driven decision-making.                  7. Familiarity with sourcing products from international markets is a plus.                  8. Proficiency in using relevant software and tools for product sourcing and procurement
